channel.title: Programming Language on
channel.description: Recent content in Programming Language on

item.title: What are the differences between Service, Factory and Provider in Angular JS?
item.description:
Factory

  • You provide a function;
  • When used Angular will run the function and return your function returned value;
  • You usually implement the factory to create an object and return it so every factory injection will give you a different object;
  • The name reflects exactly what happens: It’s a factory of new instances;

Service

  • You provide a function;
  • When used Angular will return new yourFunction();
  • Angular will cache only one instance of your object;
  • The name reflects exactly what will happen: It’s a “global” service that will be shared by any controller;

Provider

  • You provide a function;
  • Same as service, but you could access it in module config();
